headline: Soho House goes private in $2.7 billion deal as Ashton Kutcher joins the board of the swanky members’ club
summary: Founded in 1995, Soho House has never turned a profit.

headline: Private club operator Soho House going private in $2.7 billion deal
summary: Private members club operator Soho House is going private in a deal worth $2.7 billion that will pay out investors at $9 per share.

raw.headline: Private club operator Soho House going private in $2.7 billion deal
raw.summary: Private members club operator Soho House is going private in a deal worth $2.7 billion that will pay out investors at $9 per share.

headline: Dayforce Stock Surges 23%. Why Wall Street’s Excited.
summary: Dayforce  stock was soaring in early trading Monday amid a report it’s about to be bought out by a private-equity firm.  The company, which provides human resources software and had a market value of $8.4 billion as of Friday’s close, gained 23% to $65.11 just after the market opened.  On Sunday, Bloomberg reported that Thoma Bravo was in advanced talks to acquire the company.

summary: Hotel owner-operator MCR will pay $9 a share in the deal, which values Soho House at around $2.7 billion.

headline: Soho House bought for £1.3bn by US hotel giant
summary: Soho House is ending its tumultuous life on the public markets after agreeing to be taken over by a US hotel giant in a $1.8bn (£1.3bn) deal.

headline: Soho House members' club nearing a deal to go private, WSJ reports
summary: Soho House shareholders will receive $9 per share - a 17.8% premium to the closing price of $7.64 on Friday.  The deal value is based on the company's more than 195 million outstanding shares.  Billionaire Ron Burkle, who is a controlling shareholder, is expected to roll over his stake, along with several other shareholders, the Journal said.
